subject: Education
title: Spaced Repetition: Timing Is Everything
description: A micro-lesson that makes Spaced Repetition: Timing Is Everything usable.

hook.text: Cramming the night before works for the testâ€”but it's gone by Friday.

buildup.text: Ebbinghaus showed that memories decay on a predictable curve after learning.

discovery.text: Reviewing just as you're about to forget resets and extends the curve.

twist.text: Spacing feels harder than massingâ€”which is exactly why it works better.

climax.text: Optimal gaps grow over time: 1 day, 3 days, 7 days, 21 days, and beyond.

punchline.text: Forget a little, then remember a lot.

quiz.question: What makes spaced repetition effective?
options: Reviewing at the point of forgetting resets the memory curve
It reduces the total amount of study time needed
It works best when done in a single long session
